intro: Corallodiscus flabellatus var. puberulus, commonly known as the velvet discus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety leaves with a soft, pubescent texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance, it is a popular choice for indoor and outdoor cultivation.
